Key Arguments: The bill is an overreach into free speech and will change media presentation.
The terms 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' are replacing what used to be considered 'debate'.
There is concern over who decides what is considered 'truth', likening it to an Orwellian 'Ministry of Truth'.
The bill gives ACMA too much power, acting as judge and jury without transparency or accountability.
There is no clear course of appeal against ACMA's decisions, which is unacceptable in a democratic society.
The bill is seen as a means to enforce a single narrative and stifle debate and free speech.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is an overreach so far into the private business of free speech that I feel will change the way media is presented forever.
This is starting to sound resoundingly Orwellian. The Ministry of Truth perhaps?
This Draconian Bill is about nailing it to the wall. Nailing the one and only narrative. No debate, no consultation, no independent arbitration and no free speech.
This Bill is outrageous in its intention and should be immediately binned.
